events.description: Fired when one or more properties of a message have been updated.
events.name: onUpdated

events.description: Fired when messages have been moved.
events.name: onMoved

events.description: Fired when messages have been copied.
events.name: onCopied

events.description: Fired when messages have been permanently deleted.
events.name: onDeleted

events.description: Fired when a new message is received, and has been through junk classification and message filters.

extraParameters.description: Monitor all folders (including all special use folders as defined by $(ref:folders.MailFolderSpecialUse)) instead of just inbox folders and normal folders.
extraParameters.name: monitorAllFolders

events.name: onNewMailReceived

functions.description: Gets all messages in a folder.
functions.name: list

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.list() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

functions.description: Returns the next chunk of messages in a list. See $(doc:examples/messageLists) for more information.
functions.name: continueList

functions.description: Finalizes the specified list and terminates any process currently still adding messages.
functions.name: abortList

functions.description: Returns the specified message.
functions.name: get

functions.description: Returns the specified message, including all headers and MIME parts. Throws if the message could not be read, for example due to network issues.
functions.name: getFull

decrypt.description: Whether the message should be decrypted. If the message could not be decrypted, its parts are omitted. Defaults to true.

functions.description: Returns the unmodified source of a message. Throws if the message could not be read, for example due to network issues.
functions.name: getRaw

data_format.description: The message can either be returned as a DOM File or as a binary string. The historic default is to return a binary string (kept for backward compatibility). However, it is now recommended to use the File format, because the DOM File object can be used as-is with the downloads API and has useful methods to access the content, like File.text() and File.arrayBuffer(). Working with binary strings is error prone and needs special handling: includes/messages/decodeBinaryString.jsJavaScript (see MDN for supported input encodings).

decrypt.description: Whether the message should be decrypted. Throws, if the message could not be decrypted.

functions.description: Lists the attachments of a message.
functions.name: listAttachments

functions.description: Gets the content of a $(ref:messages.MessageAttachment) as a |File| object.
functions.name: getAttachmentFile

functions.description: Deletes the specified attachments and replaces them by placeholder text attachments with meta information about the original attachments and a <value>text/x-moz-deleted</value> content type. This permanently modifies the message.
functions.name: deleteAttachments

parameters.description: An array of attachments, identifying the to be deleted attachments by their <value>partName</value>.
parameters.name: partNames

functions.description: Opens the specified attachment.
functions.name: openAttachment

parameters.description: The ID of the tab associated with the message opening.
parameters.name: tabId

functions.description: Gets all messages that have the specified properties, or all messages if no properties are specified. Messages of unified mailbox folders are not included by default (as that could double the amount of returned messages), but explicitly specifying a unified mailbox folder is supported.
functions.name: query

accountId.description: Limits the search to folders of the account with the specified id.

attachment.description: Whether the message has attachments, or not. Supports to specify a $(ref:messages.QueryRange) (min/max) instead of a simple boolean value (none/some).

author.description: Returns only messages with this value matching the author. The search value is a single email address, a name or a combination (e.g.: <value>Name <user@domain.org></value>). The address part of the search value (if provided) must match the author's address completely. The name part of the search value (if provided) must match the author's name partially. All matches are done case-insensitive.

autoPaginationTimeout.description: Set the timeout in ms after which results should be returned, even if the nominal number of messages-per-page has not yet been reached. Defaults to <value>1000</value> ms. Setting it to <value>0</value> will disable auto-pagination.

body.description: Returns only messages with this value in the body of the mail.

flagged.description: Returns only flagged (or unflagged if false) messages.

folder.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.queryInfo.folder has been replaced by messages.queryInfo.folderId.
folder.description: Returns only messages from the specified folder. The <permission>accountsRead</permission> permission is required.

folderId.description: Returns only messages from the folder with the specified id. The <permission>accountsRead</permission> permission is required.

fromDate.description: Returns only messages with a date after this value.

fromMe.description: Returns only messages with the author's address matching any configured identity.

fullText.description: Returns only messages with this value somewhere in the mail (subject, body or author).

headerMessageId.description: Returns only messages with a Message-ID header matching this value.

junk.description: Returns only messages whith the specified junk state.

junkScore.description: Returns only messages with a junk score in the specified range.

messagesPerPage.description: Set the nominal number of messages-per-page for this query. Defaults to <value>100</value> messages.

new.description: Returns only messages with the specified new state.

recipients.description: Returns only messages whose recipients match all specified addresses. The search value is a semicolon separated list of email addresses, names or combinations (e.g.: <value>Name <user@domain.org></value>). For a match, all specified addresses must equal a recipient's address completely and all specified names must match a recipient's name partially. All matches are done case-insensitive.

returnMessageListId.description: The messageListId is usually returned together with the first page, after some messages have been found. Enabling this option will change the return value of this function and return the messageListId directly.

size.description: Returns only messages with a size in the specified byte range.

subject.description: Returns only messages whose subject contains the provided string.

tags.description: Returns only messages with the specified tags. For a list of available tags, call the $(ref:messages.tags.list) method.

toDate.description: Returns only messages with a date before this value.

toMe.description: Returns only messages with at least one recipient address matching any configured identity.

unread.description: Returns only unread (or read if false) messages.

functions.description: Updates message properties and tags. Updating external messages will throw an ExtensionError.
functions.name: update

functions.description: Moves messages to a specified folder. If the messages cannot be removed from the source folder, they will be copied instead of moved. Moving external messages will throw an ExtensionError.
functions.name: move

parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to move.
parameters.name: messageIds

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.move() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

parameters.description: The folder to move the messages to.
parameters.name: destination

functions.description: Copies messages to a specified folder.
functions.name: copy

parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to copy.
parameters.name: messageIds

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.copy() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

parameters.description: The folder to copy the messages to.
parameters.name: destination

functions.description: Deletes messages permanently, or moves them to the trash folder (honoring the account's deletion behavior settings). Deleting external messages will throw an ExtensionError. The skipTrash parameter allows immediate permanent deletion, bypassing the trash folder.
functions.name: delete

parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to delete.
parameters.name: messageIds

parameters.description: If true, the message will be deleted permanently, regardless of the account's deletion behavior settings.
parameters.name: skipTrash

functions.description: Imports a message into a local Thunderbird folder. To import a message into an IMAP folder, add it to a local folder first and then move it to the IMAP folder.
functions.name: import

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.import() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

parameters.description: The folder to import the messages into.
parameters.name: destination

functions.description: Archives messages using the current settings. Archiving external messages will throw an ExtensionError.
functions.name: archive

parameters.description: The IDs of the messages to archive.
parameters.name: messageIds

functions.deprecated: Deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.listTags() is now available as messages.tags.list().
functions.description: Returns a list of tags that can be set on messages, and their human-friendly name, colour, and sort order.
functions.name: listTags

functions.deprecated: Deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.createTag() is now available as messages.tags.create().
functions.description: Creates a new message tag. Tagging a message will store the tag's key in the user's message. Throws if the specified tag key is used already.
functions.name: createTag

parameters.description: Unique tag identifier (will be converted to lower case). Must not include <value>()<>{/%*"</value> or spaces.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: Human-readable tag name.
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: Tag color in hex format (i.e.: <value>#000080</value> for navy blue). Value will be stored as upper case.
parameters.name: color

functions.deprecated: Deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.updateTag() is now available as messages.tags.update().
functions.description: Updates a message tag. Throws if the specified tag key does not exist.
functions.name: updateTag

parameters.description: Unique tag identifier (will be converted to lower case). Must not include <value>()<>{/%*"</value> or spaces.
parameters.name: key

color.description: Tag color in hex format (i.e.: #000080 for navy blue). Value will be stored as upper case.

functions.deprecated: Deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: messages.deleteTag() is now available as messages.tags.delete().
functions.description: Deletes a message tag, removing it from the list of known tags. Its key will not be removed from tagged messages, but they will appear untagged. Recreating a deleted tag, will make all former tagged messages appear tagged again.
functions.name: deleteTag

parameters.description: Unique tag identifier (will be converted to lower case). Must not include <value>()<>{/%*"</value> or spaces.
parameters.name: key

types.description: A unique id representing a $(ref:messages.MessageHeader) and the associated message. This id doesn’t refer to the Message-ID email header. It is an internal tracking number that does not remain after a restart. Nor does it follow an email that has been moved to a different folder.

bccList.description: The Bcc recipients. Not populated for news/nntp messages.

ccList.description: The Cc recipients. Not populated for news/nntp messages.

external.description: Whether this message is a real message or an external message (opened from a file or from an attachment).

flagged.description: Whether this message is flagged (a.k.a. starred).

folder.description: The <permission>accountsRead</permission> permission is required for this property to be included. Not available for external or attached messages.

headerMessageId.description: The message-id header of the message.

headersOnly.description: Some account types (for example <value>pop3</value>) allow to download only the headers of the message, but not its body. The body of such messages will not be available.

junk.description: Whether the message has been marked as junk. Always <value>false</value> for news/nntp messages and external messages.

junkScore.description: The junk score associated with the message. Always <value>0</value> for news/nntp messages and external messages.

new.description: Whether the message has been received recently and is marked as new.

read.description: Whether the message has been marked as read. Not available for external or attached messages.

recipients.description: The To recipients. Not populated for news/nntp messages.

size.description: The total size of the message in bytes.

tags.description: Tags associated with this message. For a list of available tags, use $(ref:messages.tags.list).

id.description: Id of the message list, to be used with $(ref:messages.continueList) or $(ref:messages.abortList).

types.description: Represents an email message "part", which could be the whole message.

decryptionStatus.description: The decryption status, only available for the root part.

headers.description: A dictionary object of part headers as key-value pairs, with the header name as key, and an array of headers as value.

name.description: Name of the part, if it is a file.

partName.description: The identifier of this part, used in $(ref:messages.getAttachmentFile).

size.description: The size of this part. The size of message/* parts is not the actual message size (on disc), but the total size of its decoded body parts, excluding headers.

types.description: Message properties used in $(ref:messages.update) and $(ref:messages.import). They can also be monitored by $(ref:messages.onUpdated).

flagged.description: Whether the message is flagged (a.k.a starred).

junk.description: Whether the message is marked as junk. Only supported in $(ref:messages.update).

new.description: Whether the message is marked as new. Only supported in $(ref:messages.import).

read.description: Whether the message is marked as read.

tags.description: Tags associated with this message. For a list of available tags, call the $(ref:messages.tags.list) method.

types.description: Represents an attachment in a message.

contentType.description: The content type of the attachment. A value of <value>text/x-moz-deleted</value> indicates that the original attachment was permanently deleted and replaced by a placeholder text attachment with some meta information about the original attachment.

message.description: A MessageHeader, if this attachment is a message.

name.description: The name, as displayed to the user, of this attachment. This is usually but not always the filename of the attached file.

partName.description: Identifies the MIME part of the message associated with this attachment.

size.description: The size in bytes of this attachment.

max.description: The maximum value required to match the query.

min.description: The minimum value required to match the query.

functions.description: Returns a list of tags that can be set on messages, and their human-friendly name, colour, and sort order.
functions.name: list

functions.description: Creates a new message tag. Tagging a message will store the tag's key in the user's message. Throws if the specified tag key is used already.
functions.name: create

parameters.description: Unique tag identifier (will be converted to lower case). Must not include <value>()<>{/%*"</value> or spaces.
parameters.name: key

parameters.description: Human-readable tag name.
parameters.name: tag

parameters.description: Tag color in hex format (i.e.: #000080 for navy blue). Value will be stored as upper case.
parameters.name: color

functions.description: Updates a message tag. Throws if the specified tag key does not exist.
functions.name: update

parameters.description: Unique tag identifier (will be converted to lower case). Must not include <value>()<>{/%*"</value> or spaces.
parameters.name: key

color.description: Tag color in hex format (i.e.: #000080 for navy blue). Value will be stored as upper case.

functions.description: Deletes a message tag, removing it from the list of known tags. Its key will not be removed from tagged messages, but they will appear untagged. Recreating a deleted tag, will make all former tagged messages appear tagged again.
functions.name: delete

parameters.description: Unique tag identifier (will be converted to lower case). Must not include <value>()<>{/%*"</value> or spaces.
parameters.name: key

types.description: Used for filtering messages by tag in various methods. Note that functions using this type may have a partial implementation.

mode.description: Whether all of the tag filters must apply, or any of them.

tags.description: A dictionary object with one or more filter condition as key-value pairs, the key being the tag to filter on, and the value being a boolean expression, requesting whether a message must include (true) or exclude (false) the tag. For a list of available tags, call the $(ref:messages.tags.list) method.
